text: Brahmanbaria-4 is a constituency represented in the Jatiya Sangsad (National Parliament) of Bangladesh since 2014 by Anisul Huq of the Awami League. == Boundaries == The constituency encompasses Akhaura and Kasba upazilas. == History == The constituency was created in 1984 from the Comilla-4 constituency when the former Comilla District was split into three districts: Brahmanbaria, Comilla, and Chandpur. == Members of Parliament == {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Election!!Member!!Party |- |style="background-color:" | | 1986 | Liaquat Ali | Jatiya Party |- | | 1988 | Mohammad Jahangir Osman | |- |style="background-color:" | | 1991 | Mia Abdullah Wazed | Bangladesh Nationalist Party |- |style="background-color:" | | 1996 | Shah Alam | Awami League |- |style="background-color:" | | 2001 | Mushfiqur Rahman | Bangladesh Nationalist Party |- |style="background-color:" | | 2008 | Shah Alam | Awami League |- |style="background-color:" | | 2014 | Anisul Huq | Awami League |- |} == Elections == === Elections in the 2010s === Anisul Huq was elected unopposed in the 2014 general election after opposition parties withdrew their candidacies in a boycott of the election. === Elections in the 2000s === === Elections in the 1990s === == References == ==External links== * Category:Parliamentary constituencies in Bangladesh Category:Brahmanbaria District
title: Brahmanbaria-4
